intro: Bupleurum longeradiatum var. porphyranthum, commonly known as the purple-flowered bupleurum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple, often with a reddish tinge, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and have a slightly serrated edge. This species is valued in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic properties.
